.class public auto ansi sealed LinkClickedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub LinkClickedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As LinkClickedEventArgs)
public delegate void LinkClickedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, LinkClickedEventArgs ^ e);
type LinkClickedEventHandler = delegate of obj * LinkClickedEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: The that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkClickedEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
